intro: Sericanthe testui var. testui, commonly known as the yellow bell flower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a rough texture, while the flowers emit a mild fragrance. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sun, making it a popular ornamental plant in gardens.
